comments: These are the "outputs" in Conway's PRIMEGAME (see A007542). - _Alonso del Arte_, Jan 03 2011
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
example: a(4) = 128 because the fourth prime number is 7 and 2^7 = 128.
prog: (Haskell)a034785 = (2 ^) . a000040-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 07 2015, 24 Jan 2012(PARI) a(n)=1<<prime(n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 07 2012(MAGMA) [2^p: p in PrimesUpTo(100)]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 29 2014

extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Feb 04 2000
